intro: Actinodaphne celebica, commonly known as the Java cinnamon or wild cinnamon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, woody stems and broad, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits containing a single seed. Its bark and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. The plant is also valued for its essential oils, which are used in perfumery and as a flavoring agent.
